learningOutcomes: acquire and apply the basic principles of management accounting;
identify and categorise a range of information regarding a company's costs and profitability;
calculate, analyse, and interpret the different types of costing used in various industry settings.
moduleOverview:
We have all heard of the term accounting. Most of us will have a view on what accounting is, or even what accounting should be. Why are there so many different names for the same thing? Well, there are always some clues in the name and management accounting is just one part of the whole idea of accounting (and finance) in business.  

As part of your introductory accounting studies, this module considers why a business needs different types of information in its management.  

In this module you will:  

  • learn the differences between management and other types of accounting;  
  • examine why management accounting is much more fluid in its approach to calculating information;  
  • consider some simple methods for calculating important day-to-day information.
